title: Basic Prompt Engineering
description: Introduction to prompt design, testing simple prompts, and understanding LLM responses

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Does the solution work correctly? Are prompts well-structured and producing expected outputs?

excellent.description: All prompts produce accurate, relevant responses. Clear understanding of prompt structure. Edge cases handled properly.

good.description: Most prompts work correctly. Minor issues in formatting or edge case handling. Good grasp of basic concepts.

satisfactory.description: Prompts produce partially correct results. Some misunderstanding of prompt engineering principles. Basic functionality achieved.

poor.description: Prompts fail to produce expected results. Significant errors in understanding. Incomplete or non-functional solution.

criteria.name: Code Quality
criteria.description: Is the code well-written, readable, and maintainable? Proper use of API calls and error handling.

excellent.description: Clean, well-organized code. Proper variable naming. Excellent error handling. Follows Python best practices.

good.description: Good code structure. Minor style inconsistencies. Basic error handling present.

satisfactory.description: Functional but messy code. Inconsistent naming. Minimal error handling.

poor.description: Poorly structured code. No error handling. Hard to read or maintain.

criteria.name: Documentation
criteria.description: Is the code properly documented? Clear explanations of prompt design choices.

excellent.description: Comprehensive README. Well-commented code. Clear explanation of each prompt's purpose and expected behavior.

good.description: Good documentation. Most prompts explained. Comments present but could be more detailed.

satisfactory.description: Basic documentation. Minimal comments. Some prompts lack explanation.

poor.description: Little to no documentation. No comments. Unclear prompt rationale.

criteria.name: Creativity
criteria.description: Does the solution show original thinking? Creative prompt design beyond basic examples.

excellent.description: Innovative prompt designs. Demonstrates deep understanding through creative applications. Goes beyond requirements.

good.description: Some creative elements. Shows independent thinking. Meets requirements with good examples.

satisfactory.description: Basic creativity. Mostly follows examples from lectures. Minimal original thinking.

poor.description: No creativity. Direct copying of examples. No original contribution.

allowedTools: GitHub Copilot for syntax help and code completion
Stack Overflow for reference and debugging
Official API documentation for LLM providers
prohibited: Copy-pasting entire solutions from ChatGPT or similar tools
Using AI to write complete prompt engineering solutions
Submitting AI-generated code without understanding or modification
aiUsagePolicy.guidelines: You may use AI tools for syntax help and debugging, but the prompt design and implementation logic must be your own work.

deliverables: Python file (practical1.py) with at least 5 different prompt examples
README.md explaining your prompt design choices and testing methodology
Sample outputs demonstrating successful prompt responses
learningObjectives: Understand basic prompt structure and components
Design clear, specific prompts for different tasks
Test and iterate on prompt designs
Handle API responses and errors appropriately
